title: Miles Davis - Live at Montreux 1991 [Miles' Last Recording]
description:
Ã¢â‚¬Å“MILES DAVIS & QUINCY JONES: LIVE AT MONTREUXÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ finds the legendary trumpeter come full circle, returning at the end of his career to those musical highlights which set his sound and style in stone for generations of listeners. 
Drawing upon his collaborations with the innovative arranger Gil Evans, LIVE AT MONTREUX reprises some of Miles greatest moments from THE BIRTH OF THE COOL, MILES AHEAD, PORGY AND BESS and SKETCHES OF SPAIN. The fact that Miles Davis, for some 40 years, steadfastly refused to offer his fans a backwards glance in the face of new and more interesting musical challenges, only adds to the poignancy of this July 8, 1991 event. It's as if he knew that, in a spiritual sense, he had to face this music one last time. Miles rises one last time to the challenge of these ancient themes, going out like a champion...with his boots on.


Miles Davis / Quincy Jones

Miles & Quincy: Live at Montreux 

1991


  CD / 1993 / 320Kbps


Tracklist:

1. Introduction By Claude Nobs & Quincy Jones

2. Boplicity 

3. Introduction To Miles Ahead Medley 

4. Springsville 

5. Maids Of Cadiz 

6. The Duke 

7. My Ship 

8. Miles Ahead 

9. Blues For Pablo

10. Introduction To Porgy And Bess Medley 

11. Orgone 

12. Gone, Gone, Gone 

13. Summertime 

14. Here Come De Honey Man 

15. The Pan Piper 

16. Solea	


Recorded live at the 25th Anniversary of the Montreux Jazz Festival on July 8, 1991


Personnel: 

Miles Davis (trumpet)

Quincy Jones (conductor)

Kenny Garrett (alto saxophone)

Wallace Roney, Benny Bailey (trumpet, flugelhorn)

Carles Benavent (bass)

Grady Tate (drums)

The Gil Evans Orchestra

The George Gruntz Concert Jazz Band


Miles Davis / Quincy Jones
Miles & Quincy: Live at Montreux 1991
